net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Interface INonGridRow

All Superinterfaces:
IRow
public interface INonGridRow
extends IRow

Any row created by one of DesignGridLayout.row().left(), DesignGridLayout.row().center() or DesignGridLayout.row().right() implements this interface. Through this interface, you can add components to the current row.

All added components share the same width (the maximum of all components preferred widths) and are aligned on the left, center or right depending on which IRowCreator (returned by DesignGridLayout.row()) method was called to create this row.

Author:
Jean-Francois Poilpret

Method Summary
 INonGridRow add(JComponent... children)
          Adds components to this row; each component has its own "column" in the row.
 INonGridRow addMulti(JComponent... children)
          Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and use only one "column" in the row.
 INonGridRow fill()
          Sets the "extreme" component(s) of this row to fill the whole space towards the container border.
 

Method Detail

add

INonGridRow add(JComponent... children)
Description copied from interface: IRow
Adds components to this row; each component has its own "column" in the row. Components are added left to right, in the same order as they appear in the arguments list.

Specified by:
add in interface IRow
Parameters:
children - components to add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

addMulti

INonGridRow addMulti(JComponent... children)
Description copied from interface: IRow
Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and use only one "column" in the row.

Note that the width of each individual component will never grow bigger than its preferred width.

Specified by:
addMulti in interface IRow
Parameters:
children - components to assemble and add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

fill

INonGridRow fill()
Sets the "extreme" component(s) of this row to fill the whole space towards the container border. Extreme components are defined as follows:
  • For a left-aligned row: the rightmost component
  • For a centered row: the leftmost and rightmost components
  • For a right-aligned row: the leftmost component
This proves useful for implementing "group separators" as advised by Karsten Lentzsch (JLabel + JSeparator).

Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)
